barette1.description: It's hard to look manly with a pink barette in your hair, but what are you going to do when your parents are slacking on giving you a hair cut?
barette1.title: Barette 1

barette2.description: Actually, it kind of sets off my cute pink cheeks, don't you think?
barette2.title: Barette 2

circus_audience.description:
Lucie joined Felix and his schoolmates on a trip to the Berkeley library, to see the Prescott Circus.

The woman with the Cat in the Hat hat is Jeannie, one of the teachers of 4 year old class, which Felix just moved to.
circus_audience.title: Circus Audience

circus_clowns.description: Prescott Elementary School, from Oakland, has an after school circus program for 4th and 5th graders. They put together an impressive show!
circus_clowns.title: Circus Clowns

circus_globe.description: Felix's favorite act:  the acrobats jumping on the giant ball while juggling or jumping rope.
circus_globe.title: Circus Globe

grandmas.description: Nana and Baboushka are globetrotting grandmas. We've gotten postcards from all over Europe in the last few weeks.
grandmas.title: Grandmas

icecream1.description: Mimi, Milo, Felix and Owen fight back the heat wave, one popsicle at a time.
icecream1.title: Icecream 1

icecream2.description: Okay, Milo, you may try my chocolate popsicle. Just don't drool on it.
icecream2.title: Icecream 2

indianrock1.description:
The following 4 photos were taken by Katie, Owen's mom, when Felix spent most of the weekend at their place, three weeks ago. They went rock climbing!

Perry straps a homemade rock climbing harness on Felix.
indianrock1.title: Indianrock 1

indianrock2.description: We're told the harness and helmet were mostly to give the kids a thrill. But we were glad to see them in these pictures.
indianrock2.title: Indianrock 2

indianrock3.description: Yeah! Felix has made it to the top.
indianrock3.title: Indianrock 3

mouse1.description: Felix has learned how to use a mouse.
mouse1.title: Mouse 1

mouse2.description: His favorite program is Kid Pix. He likes to print out his masterworks when he is finished.
mouse2.title: Mouse 2

show1.description:
Felix put together a show for us. When we asked what it was about, he replied "It's a movie for grown ups. It's really boring, just people walking and talking".

It was a story about a soldier in transit to or from the war, we never quite got it. Very Waiting for Godot.
show1.title: Show 1

show2.description:
Milo could barely contain his enthusiasm. He jumped right out his chair, clapping frantically, and tried to climb on stage.

Notice the fashionable Bob The Builder underwear on top of Milo's jammies.
show2.title: Show 2

show3.description: At the end of the show, Felix came into the audience to shake hands and sign autographs.  Just like at the Prescott Circus!
show3.title: Show 3

description:
Felix and Milo have funny conversations. Felix likes to trick Milo into saying things he doesn't really mean.

F: Milo, are you the big brother?
M: Yeah.
F: No, Milo! You are the little brother!

F: Milo, do cats like to play in the water?
M: Yeah.
F: Mom! Milo thinks cats like playing in the water!

Milo is delighted that Felix talks to him, and doesn't seem to get that he's being made a foil for his brother's superior cognitive abilities. As for us, we figure any conversation is a good conversation. It's nice that Felix has figured out a way to have a chat with Milo.

Milo is taking a break from potty training. He was having more and more spectacular peeing accidents all over the house, so we decided to re-diaper him. He does occasionally ask to have his diaper taken off to use the toilet. He likes wearing underwear though, and he occasionally insists on wearing a pair on top of his diaper.

Dean's company is going well. It's about to launch and they've been working day and night. He's (mostly) been making it home to wrestle and Lego with the kids for a while each day, and we haven't missed a weekly date night (except for when poor Maria, our nanny, was in the hospital...).
title: July 17
